# Introduction {#sec-intro}

## Calculation Objective / Scope

Design of boat ramp concrete slab.

## Exclusions

- Geotechnical design
- Design of subgrade

## Basis of Design

In general, design is in accordance with CCAA T48 and AS 3600 for conrete structure.

## Design Standards and Codes

Unless specifically noted, the design complies with Australian Standards and selected international standards. The following summarizes the key standards used in producing this calculation:

-   AS 1170.0 - 2002 Structural design actions - Part 0: General principles
-   AS 1170.1 - 2002 Structural design actions - Part 1: Permanent, imposed and other actions 
-   AS 3600   - 2018 Concrete structures 
-   AS 4997   - 2005 Guidelines for the design of maritime structures
-   ACI 360R  - 2006 Design of Slabs-on-Ground

## Other Reference Documents {#sec-references}

Other reference documents used in this design include:

1.   NSW Boat Ramp Facility Guidelines
2.   CCAA T48 - Guide to Industrial Floors and Pavements - design, construction and specification

# Loads {#sec-loads}

## Wheel loads

Load is in accordance with @sec-references(1).

- Point load of 45kN, at 1.8m, each applied over an area of 300mm x 150mm; or
- Uniformly dsitributed load of 10kPa

Load cycles is assumed to be unlimited

```{julia}
ncycles = 1e6

s_wheel = 1800mm # wheel spacing
Pw = 45kN  # Each wheel/point
Paxle = Pw * 2 # axle load
# Paxle = 250kN
```

```{julia}
Pw / 300mm / 150mm |> kPa
```

# Subgrade definition{#sec-subgrade}

```{julia}
CBR = 3;
Hsoil = 6m # assume uniform layer
```

![Correlation between CBR and Modulus of subgrade reaction, ACI360R](images/CBR_toKs.png){#fig-cbr-to-Ks}

from @fig-cbr-to-Ks, the modulus of subgrade reaction is
```{julia}
ks = 100psi / inch |> kPa / m
```


![Correlation between long-term Young's modulus, $E_{sl}$ , and CBR](images/cbr_to_Esl_chart.png){#fig-cbr-to-E}

From @fig-cbr-to-E, the long term Young's modulus is given below.
```{julia}
νc = 0.33
Esl = fEsl(CBR) |> f2
```

![](images/beta_factor.png){#fig-beta}

From @fig-beta, for predominantly sandy soil, short term Young's modulus given below.

```{julia}
β = 0.8 #  conservatively taken for sand, e.i. lower Ess
Ess = Esl / β |> f2
```


# Concrete parameters
 
For use in FEA analysis later in the calculation. 

![Material Factor](images/table1.16.png)

![Load repetition factor, K2](images/load_repititataion_factor.png) 

```{julia}
fc = 32MPa # concrete grade
k1 = 0.85 # wheel loading factor
k2 = fk2(ncycles)  # factor for load repititions
```


# Interior slab desgin by nomograph, CCAA T48

Design by chart @fig-interior-loading

![Axle loads - Interior loading](images/interior_loading_thicknes_chart.png){#fig-interior-loading}

```{julia}
#| echo: false
tslab_interior, notes = fdesign_slab_interior(Paxle=Paxle, k1=k1, k2=k2, fc=fc, Ess=Ess, tread=s_wheel, Hsoil=Hsoil, isWheelLoad=true)

println(notes)
```

Use design thickness by FEA, refer @sec-t-by-fea

```{julia}
tslab_interior = roundto(tslab_interior, 250mm)
```


# Edge slab desgin by nomograph, CCAA T48

Design by chart @fig-fig-edge-loading

![Axle loads - Edge loading](images/edge_loading_thicknes_chart.png){#fig-edge-loading}

```{julia}
#| echo: false
tslab_edge, notes = fdesign_slab_edge(Paxle=Paxle, k1=k1, k2=k2, fc=fc, Ess=Ess, tread=s_wheel, Hsoil=Hsoil, isWheelLoad=true)
println(notes)
```

Use design thickness by FEA, refer @sec-t-by-fea

```{julia}
tslab_edge = roundto(tslab_edge, 350mm)
```

## Width of edge thickening{#sec-width-edge} 

The width of edge thickening is taken as the radius of relative stiffness as discuseed in TR34.

```{julia}
#| echo: false
b_edge_thickening = fLr(fc=fc, tslab=tslab_edge, νc=νc, Ks=ks) |> mm |> f2
println("Minimum width of edge thickening = $b_edge_thickening")
```

as will be shown laterby FEA, the width is reduced to 800mm.

# Slab design by RFEM model{#sec-t-by-fea}

The slab is design by modelling the slab in RFEM, and determining the tensile stresses.  The stress limits are calculated per  @sec-fcf-allowable

- Interior slab thicknes 210mm, desgin thickness
- Edge thickness 350mm, 800mm wide, design width
- Modulus of subgrade calculated per @sec-subgrade

## Allowable concrete flexural tensile stress{#sec-fcf-allowable}

```{julia}
f_all, notes = fF1(k1, k2, fc, isWheelLoad=true)
println(notes)
```

# Punching check

```{julia}
Rpunching, stro = fVpunch_tire(; fc=fc, tslab=tslab_interior, btire=300mm, ptire=Pw / (300mm * 150mm), wheel_load=Pw, isInterior=true)

println(stro)
```

Punching capacity is `{julia} Rpunching` $\geq$ `{julia} Pw`, PASS.


# Shrinkage Reinforcement

```{julia} 
l = 25 * tslab_interior # typical length of jointed slab, plain concrete design
b = 200mm # bar  sapacing

As, stro = fshrinkage_bars(; b=b, l=b, t=tslab_interior, fy=500MPa, is_top_and_bottom=true)

println(stro)
```

Provide SL82, top and bottom, galvanized

```{julia}
As_provided = π / 4 * (7.6mm)^2
```

# Summary of slab design

- slab thickness at the interior is 250mm
- slab thickness at the edges is 350mm
- width of thickening is 800mm
